fields.description:
It is impossible to remove deployment key in repo.

When I try to that on [https://bitbucket.org/trustycoin/ch-py/admin/access-keys/|https://bitbucket.org/trustycoin/ch-py/admin/access-keys/] page,

this message come up:

h1. Error
There was an error communicating with the server, please try again.
fields.summary: Cannot remove deployment key in repo

fields.description:
The first item in the breadcrumb at the top of many pages in the Bitbucket UI recently started linking to what looks like the guid of the owner instead of the name.  Not a big deal, it’s still functional, but it’s ugly and it threw off my recent pages list, which is how I navigate quickly between many repositories.

I’m attaching a screenshot showing the bit I’m referring to and its markup
fields.summary: The owner link in the breadcrumb at the top of the UI is using an escaped guid rather than the owner name

fields.description:
Provision for users to define to Parent branch, as well as which are the child branches that a parent can accept for forming a Merge.\\
What this helps achieve are accidental Merges from users.

Now at the same time we have a work around for the same as listed below. However, there is always a scope of human error:

* Give Write permissions only to developers who would need to perform this action.
* Make sure that this set of developers can only merge via pull request
* Place multiple reviewers to remove the element of error committed by one
* Choose the premium option of Prevent merge with unresolved merge checks
fields.summary: Restrict Branch Level Merge | Branch Permissions

fields.description:
This means usually I am able to type a couple of characters into Title, and then suddenly I am typing in Description.

The previous behavior as I recall it, and the correct behavior in my opinion, is not to have Description call for focus at all. Title is the required field.
fields.summary: The "Create Issue" button initially gives focus to the "Title" field but then quickly forces it to the "Description" field

fields.description: I created a new private repo, pushed code, then clicked on the “Source” tab button to refresh but it wouldn’t refresh and show the code I just added. I had to click another tab and then click source again for my code to show up
fields.summary: First push code doesn't appear after clicking on "Source" tab again

fields.description:
When creating a pull request from a Jira ticket, the branch associated with the ticket is not selected as the source branch by default. Instead, the last used branch is selected.

*Steps to reproduce:*

* Create a branch on Bitbucket related to a Jira ticket (i.e. *hotfix/ABC-32-newfix*)
* On Jira, create a pull request through the ticket associated with the branch (ABC-32)

*Expected outcome:*

* Bitbucket Pull request being auto populated with the branch *hotfix/ABC-32-newfix* as the source branch

*Actual outcome:*

* Bitbucket Pull request selects the last used as the source branch.
fields.summary: Pull request created through Jira selects the wrong source branch

fields.description:
Would be nice to be able to trigger certain pipelines by appending a commit message command.

E.g. {{FIX-2121 - Added Foo token to Bar payload #pipeline:deploy-qa}} as a commit message could trigger the pipeline “deploy-qa”. Where “deploy-qa” is the pipeline name.

That should be enabled per-pipeline through configuration, and only available for {{custom}} pipelines.

Would be a huge time saver for quick deployments that can’t be fully automated.
fields.summary: Trigger custom pipeline from commit message

fields.description:
We need to perform code review in all code related to the PR which was opened.

We noticed that sometimes the overview page is not displaying all changes.

In the overview page, I cannot see all changes from one commit, which is part of the pull request.

The side effect is that, we are missing code during the review phase because the overview page is not displaying all changes, also we cannot comment on the commit page because it won't be part of the pull request.

I do believe this is a bug. Could you assist with it?

Best regards,

Vinicius
fields.summary: Overview tab in pull request is not showing the entire changes

fields.description: My colleague came to me just now with an issue related to double quotes and dots in a pull request. When he tried to change the code for the pull request using the provided editor on the Bitbucket website and saved his changes, the double quotes and the dots were converted to the characters: {{ï¿½}}, {{ï¿½}} and {{ï¿½}}.
fields.summary: Pull request editor double quotes and dots converted to strange characters

fields.description:
When viewing my code in Visual Studio or Notepad++ the alignment is perfect, but it does not display correctly in bitbucket.

Bitbucket snippet:

!359878274-spacing%20issue.PNG|thumbnail!\\
‌

Visual Studio snippet:

!4274336249-VS.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Alignment/display issue
Error when removing deploy key

fields.description:
This was originally from service request: BBS-106694. The rep handling that request suggested that I file this here.

--- Original issue:

{code}
This may be an "as expected" race condition, but is still annoying/distracting. The rough steps to reproduce are:

1. Have a default pipelines configuration that catches all branches.
2. Have a PR on some branch X that triggers this default pipeline.
3. Push some final changes to branch X. This triggers a pipeline execution (as expected).
4. Before the pipeline in step 3 actually starts, merge the PR with "delete branch X" selected. This is the race condition.
5. Note that the pipeline in step 3 errors out with something like "fatal: Remote branch X not found in upstream origin"

Possible resolutions:

1. Cancel any pipelines running on branch X when branch X is deleted. This would still probably have a race condition if the cancel doesn't happen before the error is triggered.
2. Don't let users merge and delete branch X while there are pipelines for branch X still running / scheduled.
3. Queue the merge to happen later after all the pending pipelines have (successfully?) completed.
{code}
fields.summary: Improve user experience of Pipelines triggering even when branch deleted

fields.description:
I put this question on SO:

[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56225929/checking-cache-using-add-command-with-dockerfile/56226187|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56225929/checking-cache-using-add-command-with-dockerfile/56226187#56226187]

Problem: Docker is not caching my ADD commands

If the answer to the question is correct, it’s because apparently Bitbucket is not properly setting the {{Last-Modified}} HTTP header.

Can you confirm this is a bug?
fields.summary: Fix http headers for (Docker) caching

fields.description:
When I’m on my team page: [https://bitbucket.org/fooTeam/|https://bitbucket.org/fooTeam/] and tap on create button on the side (Big plus sign), a side menu open. Items in this side menu all reference creating resources for team: “fooTeam”. For example: Repository creation url is: [https://bitbucket.org/repo/create?owner=fooTeam|https://bitbucket.org/repo/create%3Fowner%3DfooTeam]

When is open it I am presented with option to specify parameters for new repository. But if i have no rights to create repository for this team and I am not member on any other team, i have no option to pick team nor am i told that I am going to create new repository for my personal account. This is very misleading as i came from my team view and the URL also suggest that repository is going to be created for the team.

Suggestion: If user has no rights to create repository for {{owner}} team (specified in URL), show some kind of warning.
fields.summary: Misleading UI for Repository creation when user has no rights to create one

fields.description: When i try to delete my SSH key in “Access Keys”, got an error saying “There was an error communicating with the server, please try again.“
fields.summary: Cant delete my SSH key

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Image link using markdown in the readme is broken when preview. Committing the change will show the image in the overview page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an image link in readme
# Preview the change
# Image is broken

h3. Expected Results
Showed the image in the preview

h3. Actual Results
Image is shown as broken in preview
fields.summary: Readme link image is broken in preview

fields.description:
To be able to build automation to track deployments across large numbers of repos we need the capability to query the appropriate information from the Bitbucket API.  The API has an endpoint for deployments but the endpoint is not filterable except for an undocumented “[state.name|http://state.name]” filter.

API Documentation:

[[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deployments/|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Bworkspace%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/deployments/]](https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deployments)

Please add filtering capabilities for the following:

* Environment
* Release
fields.summary: /deployments API needs filtering capabilities

fields.description:
When I try to clone a git repo using HTTPS link in git bash (v 2.21.0.windows.1), it shows the following error:

bq. fatal: unable to access '[https://bitbucket.org/':|https://bitbucket.org/%27:] schannel: AcquireCredentialsHandle failed: SEC_E_ALGORITHM_MISMATCH (0x80090331) - The client and server cannot communicate, because they do not possess a common algorithm.


I am running Windows 10 x64 Home Single Language (version 1809). Please help.
fields.summary: Unable to clone git epo

fields.description:
Liking the comment on a commit is not working -

* Choose one of the commit in Bitbucket UI
* Make a comment on the commit
* There is no change in the Like button when author of the commit message or another person click on Like button. When checked on the console logs we see a 405 error code and before that you will notice that the link switches to a Pending state
fields.summary: Liking the comment on a commit is not working

fields.description: It would be nice to have the ability to collapse comments and files in pull requests. When there’s a long discussion it would be helpful to be able to focus on certain sub-sections better.  And for long pull requests with many files, it would be nice to have the ability to collapse files that I have already reviewed.
fields.summary: Ability to collapse items (comments, files)

fields.description:
Users cannot remove files from the create screen of the issue tracker. There is no button to click to delete the uploaded attachments.

The only options are:

# Start over again by canceling the whole issue
# Create the issue and then delete the file
# Remove from the edit screen

We need to get this addressed and have a remove button in the create screen for file attachments.
fields.summary: Cannot remove files from Create screen of Issue Tracker

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Fork repositories will not show the list of the fork in the UI if the user doesn't have access to the forked repositories. This only happens for hg repositories and if the access is given the UI will only show 1 fork instead of others if there's more

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a hg repositories
# Fork the repositories to another user (make sure the user doesn't have permission in the current account)
# Once finished fork go back to the main repo and see in the UI it should show 0 fork

h3. Expected Results
Should show the list of forked repositories without the need of access

h3. Actual Results
Doesn't show fork repositories in the UI

h3. Workaround
Ask the user to give read-only access to the forked repositories.
fields.summary: (HG) forked repositories will not show in the main fork repositories UI if the admin/user of main repo doesn't have access to the forked repositories

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Access [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com] and set your full name as “山田 太郎” or other multi-byte names which contain a space
# In the repo that the user has access to, create a new PR and mention that user as PR reviewer by entering “山田 太郎”

h3. Expected Result:
The user appears in the suggested list

h3. Actual result:
The user doesn't show up

h3. Workaround:
Change the full name to a single-byte one, or exclude the space from [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Unable to set user as PR reviewer when multi-byte chars that contain a space are set as the full name of Atlassian account

fields.description:
When I try to create a new branch in my repo, the system cannot find any branches for me to base it off of. As a result I can’t create a branch, which is preventing me from checking in a hotfix for deployment. This happened briefly yesterday and has been happening now for at least two hours. Screenshot attached.

!178456851-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-16%20at%201.09.56%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to create new branches

fields.description:
* during a login to the Bitbucket, I submitted correct password and I was redirected to a page which required 6 digit recovery codes. I had my codes with me and none of them appeared to be valid and I could not get in…
* I was able to disable 2FA completely with 2nd PC where my session was active. Login using 1st PC was still the same and it did not make any sense.
* In the end, I was able to login using Google account in the end. Weird login logic is still the same in browser’s anonymous window when I do not use Google to login…
fields.summary: do not ask for 2FA 6 digit recovery code when it is disabled

fields.description:
Current

* normally it triggers another run of a pipeline and starts looking for a branch which is not there so it fails

Expected

* should it look and rerun pipeline for a commit instead (using newly created branch in a repo as a pointer to GIT) or that ‘rerun' button should not be visible?
fields.summary: Improve 'rerun' UX when the branch no longer exists

fields.description:
When downgrading a plan on Bitbucket, it would say "Downgrade will be processed at the end of billing cycle" and you will have an option to downgrade the button.

Clicking the downgrade button leads to a 404 Error. The button redirects to an invalid URL

https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<USERNAME>/upgrade/undefined

*Current Workaround*

* Navigate to Bitbucket Account Settings and upgrade the account plan.
fields.summary: Cancel Downgrade button returns 404 error

fields.description:
Let's say I have 2 repository in my bitbucket account in the same project

1. common-api\\
2. common-web

Now, common-core has a dependency of common-api at compile time.

In this scenario, In local, I can publish common-api to maven local so it available to common-core.

But with bucket pipeline with Gradle its says common-api not found.

Any solution or workaround for this without using public artifactory/repository?

My bitbucket.pipelines.yml

image: openjdk:8

pipelines:\\
default:

* step:\\
caches:
* gradle\\
script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.\\
# You must commit the Gradle wrapper to your repository\\
# [https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/gradle_wrapper.html|https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/gradle_wrapper.html]
* bash ./gradlew build -i -x javadoc
fields.summary: Bitbucket pipeline caching dependencies across repository

fields.description: Please add support for Rust syntax highlighting throughout Bitbucket (code review, commits, diff…)
fields.summary: Add support for Rust syntax highlighting

fields.description:
!1492578223-image.png|thumbnail!\\
I have this person in my repo with write permission but i cant add him to review my pull request. The same never happened before

‌

!3334105658-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot add a reviewer for the pull request

fields.description: It would be really awesome if when doing code review, one could filter by a change type. For example, sometimes we decide to delete a feature and refactor other parts of a codebase. I typically don’t care what lines of code got deleted in said deleted files, but I do care about the refactor changes, but to get to those refactor changes, I have to sometimes scroll through thousands of lines of deleted code I don’t really care about to get to what I actually want to see. I think it would make sense to have a feature that says “Hide deleted”, “Hide Renamed”, “Hide binary file rewrite”, “Hide Added”, and “Hide Modified”.
fields.summary: Change type filtering for code review

fields.description:
The following API call fails most of the time, giving errors like {"type": "error", "error": {"message": "Something went wrong", "id": "e5140c8320b4464988fe309381b86be2"}}

[https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/thisiszone/permissions/repositories?q=user.account_id<"557058:022fa238-6cd0-4a9b-9f15-e4bb83f1f2d4"+AND+user.account_id!~"c6193fe80b0f"|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/thisiszone/permissions/repositories%3Fq%3Duser.account_id%253C%2522557058:022fa238-6cd0-4a9b-9f15-e4bb83f1f2d4%2522%2BAND%2Buser.account_id%21~%2522c6193fe80b0f%2522]

fields.description:
Since PR creators can approve their own PR's why not show that badge on the list?

In this screenshot the creator of the develop → master PR has approved it but that is not visible from this page. Simply adding the green check badge as done on the right column for the reviewers will bring extra insight and allow different work flows.

!4279521666-Screenshot%202019-05-15%20at%2015.21.26.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show approval badge on PR author when listing PR's
Confusing errors when trying to approve pull requests using Rest API

fields.description:
Hi there,

It would be great if we could collapse/expand a block of content in markdown.

e.g.

{code}
<details>
<summary>summary</summary>

content
</details>
{code}

This works fine in many markdown editors, except on bitbucket.
fields.summary: Ability to collapse a block of content in markdown

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

# Make REST API call: [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{user}/{repo}/commits/master?pagelen=10|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/%257Buser%257D/%257Brepo%257D/commits/master%3Fpagelen%3D10]
# Follow next link from response

Expected behavior - link works and returns next batch of commits

Actual behavior - link returns empty list

Workaround - remove ctx parameter from link and leave only pagelen and page parameters
fields.summary: Next link in paginated API response not working

fields.description:
Hello Bit bucket Team,

We were exploring the possibility of using Bit bucket pipelines for our deployment automation efforts of one of our JS projects.

We hit a roadblock at the user level restrictions for running a deployment.

So far, we’ve found out that for a Bit-bucket premium account, only the user with write permissions to a repository will have access to deploy the code as well.

This goes against our organization’s security compliance requirement, which roughly translates as person who commits code should not be able to deploy code.

The way our org is structured,we would like to know if there is a user management feature we are missing where we have the flexibility to configure user groups/permissions independently.
fields.summary: User level restrictions to run the bit-bucket deployment pipeline.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Access [https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<slug>/groups/|https://bitbucket.org/account/user/%253Cslug%253E/groups/%253E]
# Enter a mail address of a new user(a mail address that doesn’t belong to any existing Bitbucket Cloud user)
# Click Add

h3. Expected Result
The user is added and an invitation email will be sent

h3. Actual Result
Nothing happens
fields.summary: Unable to add a user who is new to Bitbucket Cloud at https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<slug>/groups/

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Access [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com] and set your full name as “山田” or other multi-byte names
# In the repo that the user has access to, create a new PR and mention that user as PR reviewer by entering “山田”

h3. Expected Result:
The user appears in the suggested list

h3. Actual result:
The user doesn't show up

h3. Workaround:
Change the full name to a single-byte one from [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Unable to set user as PR reviewer when multi-byte chars are set in the full name of Atlassian account

fields.description: I’m using version 66.0.5 of Firefox. Each time I attempt to login, I get redirected to the [id.atlassian.com|http://id.atlassian.com] login domain and the browser hangs. I also see errors in the console that might he helpful. Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: unable to login using Firefox

fields.description:
We are using {{docker run [...]}} and mounting volumes because we want to maintain a consistent way to build our code. [Ideally the same way a developer builds the code in their laptop is the same way we build in CI.|https://medium.com/magnetcoop/using-docker-compose-in-bitbucket-pipelines-81ead8cf0153]

For that we're also using custom [caches for maven|https://medium.com/magnetcoop/caching-dependencies-in-bitbucket-pipelines-when-running-a-dockerized-build-44c66732597d] artifacts.

A few days ago (we can pinpoint exactly when, but in the last 7-10 days) things have started to fail again, following exactly the same pattern that we described in issue [https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/17313|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/17313] (reported by our colleague Ivan Perdomo last November). The custom cache setup broke. A container spawned from a {{docker run}} command in a step can write to the _host_ folder, but when you enable the custom cache definition it breaks due to permissions.

You can find the minimum failing test case in this repository:

* [https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug|https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug]

We hadn’t change anything since last November in that repository, when we originally produced the failing test case. We simply rerun pipeline build [#32|https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/32] (the one that run successfully, after your team rolled out a change to fix the problem at that time). That rerun (build [#33|https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/33]) failed with exactly the same symptoms that we had last November. After changing the {{docker run [...]}} command not to mount the custom cache, it built successfully (build [#35|https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/35]).

We’ve had to disable custom caches for maven artifacts in all of our pipelines to be able to keep them working!

Again this was totally unexpected! After last November incident, we have been been monitoring the pages where changes to Pipelines are posted  and nothing related to this behavior change as been announced anywhere!

Please, could you warn your customers before any of those changes? Even if you think nothing is going to break their currently working setups, some of them (like us) are going to be unpleasantly surprised (to put it mildly).
fields.summary: Custom dependency cache and user namespace remapping (again!)

fields.description:
When adding a comment or task I get notified (bottom right corner) about my own edit. Clicking on this notification duplicates a created task. Upon reload, the duplication is gone.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# Use the old pull request UI
# In a pull request, add a comment
# Wait until you see the notification on the right side of the screen
# Create a task
# Click the notification

*Before clicking the notification*:\\
!1941690290-pr_notification.png|thumbnail!

*After clicking the notification*:\\
!3217986734-pr_notification_after_clicking.png|thumbnail!

It would be best if there will be no notification for your own comment.
fields.summary: Click PR notification duplicates task

fields.description:
In a Pipelines build, the navigation button on the bottom right is overlapping the time spent.

!821099921-Pipelines_buttons.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result
The button will not overlap the "time" spent in a script.

h3. Actual Result
The button overlaps the "time" spent in a script.

h3. Workaround
Point your mouse cursor outside the build script and the navigation button should hide
fields.summary: Pipelines build navigation button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users would like to be able to set the value of a repository variable as another variable.
 This is possible to do in the Pipelines script, however it is not possible to do so in 'Repository variables' page or 'Workspace variables' pages or in the Deployment variables.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to reference other variables in the above pages as well, as follows: !2843221588-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-14%20at%2016.06.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow users to set the value of a repository variable as another variable

fields.description: Since a few days ago, when editing an issue, if no comment is provided, the whole description of the issue is set as edition comment.
fields.summary: Edition comment duplicates issue description

fields.description:
The "like" button doesn't work on comment which belong to commits. Nevertheless it works on comments which belong to pull requests.

It use to work a few weeks / months ago.
fields.summary: The "like" button doesn't work on comment's commits

fields.description: I would love to have a way to set the priority to my pull requests when I have a lot of them.Or to set the sequence of the merge with the branch.
fields.summary: I would love to have a way to prioritize my pull requests.

fields.description:
I have this command

{code}
curl -u "${bitbucket_email}:${bitbucket_password}" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "Accept:application/json" "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/interos/{b89131e7-a658-4bef-93b3-e4c90a13b0cf}/commits/"
{code}

*but I keep getting HTML instead of JSON!*

Here is my issue/question: [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56122224/how-to-get-stream-list-of-commit-shas-from-bitbucket-repo|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56122224/how-to-get-stream-list-of-commit-shas-from-bitbucket-repo]

please help! thx
fields.summary: Cannot retrieve JSON from restful endpoint

fields.description: Being able to see who made a major change to a pr (destination branch or other settings) and that a change was made is important.
fields.summary: Edits to PRs (i.e. change to destination branch, pr name etc.) do not show in the PR history

fields.description: Public user(not logged in to Bitbucket) are being redirected to “Something went wrong” error page when trying to access public issue tracker.
fields.summary: Anonymous user is unable to view the public issue tracker in Bitbucket repository

fields.description:
Getting a problem recently where another developer on the team is unable to add me as a reviewer when creating a new PR. Problem started about a week ago. Prior to that he has never had a problem adding me as a reviewer when creating a new PR. He was also not able to tag me using @kenXXXXXXXX in a PR comment a few days ago but that seems to be working today. He is able to add other reviewers (at least a few we’ve tried) but not me, and he can tag others in comments but not me. I&-#39-;m wondering if it is somehow related to this: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bbkb/changes-to-usernames-in-bitbucket-cloud-969521174.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bbkb/changes-to-usernames-in-bitbucket-cloud-969521174.html]

If I add myself to the default reviewer list for the repo, he is able to create a new PR with me as reviewer, and he can also (later) edit/remove me as a reviewer and then (later still) add me back in as a reviewer.

Otherwise, the auto-complete drop-down just says &-#34~~;*Found no matches for Ken*&~~#34~~; Here&~~#39~~;s a screenshot (different reviewer name since I can&~~#39-;t reproduce the issue in exactly the same way):

!1504010699-cannot-add-pr-reviewer.png|thumbnail!\\
Perhaps also related to this: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-pull-request-reviewer-auto-completion-doesn-t-working/qaq-p/1081186#U1081894|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-pull-request-reviewer-auto-completion-doesn-t-working/qaq-p/1081186#U1081894]
fields.summary: Reviewers missing when creating a new Pull Request.

fields.description: We need to add some requirements to pick up support verification of certs that requires SNI, telling a proxy server which cert to serve up: [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18578439/using-requests-with-tls-doesnt-give-sni-support/18579484#18579484|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18578439/using-requests-with-tls-doesnt-give-sni-support/18579484#18579484]
fields.summary: Support SNI for webhooks

fields.description: The issues page of my repository is broken if I am not logged in. I allow anonymous users to create issues.
fields.summary: Broken Issues Page

fields.description: When i was doing a code review on a *Pull Request*, one of the lines of code(the last) was covered by the scroll bar. Simple fix would be to add an additional line at the bottom per file.
fields.summary: Scroll bar covering code - Add padding at the bottom
Changing Assignee on an Issue leaves a comment with the whole description again. - Customer's behalf

fields.description: A user has attached a file to an issue via a comment.  The link 404s
fields.summary: Links to attachments to issues are invalid -- 404

fields.description:
Browser: Chrome 73.0.3683.75

OS: Ubuntu 18.04

[https://bitbucket.org/myorg/myproject/commits/all|https://bitbucket.org/modfin/irma-v2-backend/commits/all] stalls for 100,000 ms waiting for [https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/1e231708b5b9b7bcc1d7fb3cc75ca7ea?s=64&ts=1557755014|https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/1e231708b5b9b7bcc1d7fb3cc75ca7ea%3Fs%3D64%26ts%3D1557755014] to load until it {{504}}s, then other assets will load.

View is usable while network is stalling but I get a spinner instead of a favicon on the browsertab (and no avatar tiles, of course)
fields.summary: Avatars get request stalls site load

fields.description:
Tried both chrome / firefox in/out of private mode and issue is repeated. Creating a new PR doesn’t resolve the issue.

Please see video.
fields.summary: Continuous PR reloading page, unusable.

fields.description:
With the bitbucket issue tracker, on every re-assignment. The description of the issue duplicates and get's associated as the comment along with the assignee change.

This is not a pleasant UI experience for users & causes a lot of redundancy.

This is easily reproducible as seen from the screenshot:
fields.summary: Issue Tracker | Description duplicates as comment on user reassignment in an Issue (BBCS-433)

fields.description:
Currently, when you create a Mercurial repository via API, there's no field for you to specify the "non-publishing repository" option.

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D#post

!3386702928-hg_draft_option.png|thumbnail!

*Feature request:*

It would be best if we could have the "non-publishing" field available when creating a Mercurial repository via API.
fields.summary: API field for non-publishing Mercurial repository

fields.description:
Navigating [bitbucket.org|http://bitbucket.org] is a pain when basic actions often take 4+ seconds to complete.

This example was clicking the ‘sort by votes’ button in an issue tracker and took 12 seconds.

My internet connection is not the issue.

!3187174564-Vs0P68OHvs.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Certain website actions incredibly slow

fields.description: For a branch “develop“ in my repository I am not able to view the list of previous commits on that branch.
fields.summary: Not able to view commit history of a branch

fields.description: Users having Atlassian Access need to create an app password, in case they want to do the git operations using HTTPS. It would be useful if we could have a login window which would redirect to the IdP for authentication
fields.summary: Git operations using Atlassian Access

fields.description:
Hi Team , My repository size keeps on increasing after I delete so may branches from my repo. The repo size becomes 2 GB and I was not not push my changes because it went to read only mode. I deleted garbage data then repo size change to 2.7 GB and when I delete some unused branches around 20 branches I deleted the repo size goes to 4 GB.

Can you please help to look into my issue
fields.summary: [Bitbucket]Repository size keeps on increasing after deleting branches and garbage data

fields.description: When I finish putting in a title for an issue, I press tab, but instead of taking me to the description field, I have to either tab through every option in the text editing pane, or use my house to click into the description field. Obviously there are some accessibility considerations here, but I find it really annoying to not just be able to tab from title to description.
fields.summary: Pressing tab from the title field should take me to the description field

fields.description:
When someone creates a Bitbucket account, they are asked to fill in their email, full name and password, and then a verification email is sent to their email address.

In case there is a hard bounce of the verification email due to a typo or misconfiguration of the email account, the user does not get notified.

In case of a hard bounce, instead of displaying the following screen: !3156449324-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-10%20at%2017.58.29.png|thumbnail!

show a message to the user that their email was bounced and a suggestion to contact support.

This way the user has feedback that the email delivery failed and can contact support to get help with this issue.
fields.summary: When the verification email for the account creation fails, show some feedback to the user in the UI

fields.description:
Noticed this in last few weeks, Bitbucket now started giving me notifications of a new comment on some PR for comments that I myself made, and while I am in between the process of reviewing the PR.

i.e. I make a PR comment, and while I am on the same page, giving other comments, I start receiving notifications of my own PR comment count on the bottom right.

This is a nuisance.
fields.summary: Bitbucket has started giving notifications of PR comments to the author itself

fields.description:
When the number of tags in a Mercurial repo is more than 9, the 'Create branch' dialog doesn't show all branches in the 'From branch' field.

It shows only the main branch and the tags. It is still possible to find the other branches and branch off of them, if you start typing their name in the 'From branch' field. However, it is not intended behavior that the rest of the branches won't show in the initial list.
fields.summary: 'From branch' field in 'Create branch' dialog does not show all branches in a Mercurial repo with more than 9 tags

fields.description:
As it says in the description.

Having the entire description copy/pasted in a new comment every time someone edits it causes an extreme amount of garbage if you don’t manually delete it.

Instead, remove the comment and ideally introduce an edit history

example.
fields.summary: Editing issue description copy/pastes the entire description into a new comment.

fields.description:
Scenario:

You login in [bitbucket.org|http://bitbucket.org] access you repository and try to navigate to the main pipelines page of your branch.

Windows 10,

When using edge’s default distributed browser, the left menu is loaded correctly but the content is just waiting and waiting

When you access same URL in google chrome, it loads with out problem.
fields.summary: Pipelines and deployments page don't work in MS Edge

fields.description:
The website show me the following error:

Not getting that to display...

While we check things on our end, contact support if the problem persists.

Try again
fields.summary: Error in my private repo

fields.description: Unable to see one commit.
fields.summary: Unable to see one commit.

fields.description: Deployment Variables are currently not in the public facing REST API. As users are also using our other Variable APIs, it’d valuable to release these to maintain consistency.
fields.summary: Add Deployment Variables to the public REST API

fields.description: I was looking for a string that needs to be replaced throughout our repositories. The search results came back with 300 files. I’d love a way to export the repository + filename so I can create a checklist of files that need to be modified. As it stands, I’ll need to build this list by hand.
fields.summary: Export Search Results

fields.description:
Got : [https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-bitbucket/add-users-to-a-team-861176362.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-bitbucket/add-users-to-a-team-861176362.html]

h2. We're moving mountains to get it sorted.
View our [status page|https://status.atlassian.com] and subscribe for\\
service updates.

fields.description:
Hi,

The {{Activity}} page for a particular pull request does not work. Clicking on it always leads to an error. Can you please help us look into this issue? Here is the link for the PR:

[https://bitbucket.org/petsc/petsc/pull-requests/1562/second-order-adjoint-ode-solvers/activity|https://bitbucket.org/petsc/petsc/pull-requests/1562/second-order-adjoint-ode-solvers/activity]

Thanks
fields.summary: Activity page cannot be loaded

fields.description:
Hi!

There is a problem that new files created using Markdown syntax are not displayed correctly after saving.

!2669559995-2019-05-09%2021-16-19%20%D0%A1%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%88%D0%BE%D1%82%20%D1%8D%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B0.png|thumbnail!\\
!3965823203-2019-05-09%2021-16-40%20%D0%A1%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%88%D0%BE%D1%82%20%D1%8D%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B0.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Markdown not rendering

fields.description:
When using “new PR experience” and “excluded file patterns”.

The excluded file shows a link "open files diff" that will open {{git diff target..source -- file}} when it should be opening {{git diff target...source -- file}} (note the {{.}}'s )
fields.summary: Incorrect diff shown in pull request

fields.description:
Example:

My collegoue add me a code to check, I approved the pull request. Later someone pushed other commits to that pull request that wasn't checked by anyone but the pull request still keeps its Approved flag. In this state if i look to the pull request it looks like it is checked and approved to me, *but it may contains some critical errors pushed after the approval*.

Solution:\\
When someone pushes changes to open PR, the approved flag from all users should be removed.
fields.summary: Approve from pull request should be removed when someone pushes new changes

fields.description: Pushing and cloning over SSH is painfully slow, it seems to be the same issue as the 3rd of May ([https://bitbucket.status.atlassian.com/incidents/8spfm24fyr95|https://bitbucket.status.atlassian.com/incidents/8spfm24fyr95])
fields.summary: Slow connection over SSH

fields.description:
We have Jira and Bitbucket cloud.

Reproduction:

* on a Jira issue click on a branch, and then ‘Create pull request’
* The url looks like this:

{code}
https://bitbucket.org/%7B%7D/%7B<<SOME_UID>>%7D/pull-requests/new?source=<<SOURCE_BRANCH_THAT_WE_SAW_IN_JIRA_ISSUE>>
{code}

‌

Expected result: We end up in the create-pullrequest wizard. As the the source branch, the correct branch is selected.

Actual result: We end up in the create-pullrequest wizard. However, as the source branch, a seemingly different branch is selected.

This is confusing, and leads to people accidentally creating wrong pullrequest.
fields.summary: create-pull request wizard randomizes the source branch, after getting there from the 'create branch' link from JIRA

fields.description: Since, there are too many pull requests to approve and merge; and some may need approval from multiple people before merging, would like to have a filter to set aside already approved PRs.
fields.summary: Option to filter approved pull requests

fields.description:
If I update a issue property (the component property for example) after a issue has been created, the full issue description is added to the comment, instead of just the property change.

Even modifying the comment afterwards doesn't allow me to remove the description and update the comment.
fields.summary: Modifying a issue property duplicates the issues description in the comments

fields.description:
As per the title, on every page the repository name looks just fine in this section:\\
!2511427060-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-08%20at%2017.02.54.png|thumbnail!

However, only for the Pipelines page, the repository name shows up the first and last six letters of your repository name in that section of the page, as shown on the image below:\\
!3996345929-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-08%20at%2017.02.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pipelines should use repo name in breadcrumbs and not truncate name

fields.description:
In our case - running all tests on single commit taking ~10-15 mins. People sometimes are pushing new and new commits to the same branch, as result - tests are executed on different commits on the same branch in parallel.

In order to optimize used build minutes I’d like to have ability to enable cancelling builds on branch when new commit was added, for instance Travis doing in this way.

In order to not brake builds that are expected to be ran in parallel - we could cancel builds that were triggered automatially, not manually.
fields.summary: Cancel build on branch when new commit added

fields.description:
Currently, if someone imports a repo in a team account and have failed, administrators of a team account get an email notification stating that a repository import has been failed.

However, the email notification doesn't have the ability to view import logs as to where the repository import fails.

*Feature request*:

It would be great if we can enhance our notification feature to:

* Allow administrators to see the reason of the failed repository import based on import logs via email notification
* Allow administrators to know who initiated a repository import
fields.summary: Import repository notification

fields.description:
Hi,

what about to add a sorting feature in the pull requests view? Let’s say by people count (who approved), creation date, modification date, number of comments.
fields.summary: Sorting in the pull requests view.

fields.description:
Bitbucket captures the macOS system-wide keystroke Command-F in Safari for a special search in the file viewer, and not in the entire webpage as the search is for.

!1173737822-Screenshot%202019-05-08%20at%202.30.44%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket captures the systemwide Command+F key combination in Safari

fields.description: When clicking the Prior Comments button for a file within a Bitbucket Pull Request it will bring up the window showing the previous comments. Upon clicking Reply and then the Emoji icon the pop up will appear behind the Prior Comments window making all emojis unclickable preventing the addition of emojis to the comment reply.
fields.summary: Emoji popup appears behind Prior Comments window

fields.description:
The create branch option on the branch UI of a repository lists only a maximum of 10 branches from the filtered string. The request is to make it more convenient to search for users who have a lot of branches. Example: Feature-01,,,,,,Feature-abc-60. This demands the search string to be accurate if not the branch doesn’t show-up within the dropdown which shows only 10 branches.\\
Options that can be considered to improve:

* Provide a Next button
* Allow for Manual entry instead of search
* Include a larger scrollable list/drop down
fields.summary: Create Branch drop down needs to filter all branches not just 10

fields.description:
Bitbucket search functionality in Bitbucket UI doesn't return all the matches of the searched string in files.

This behavior was reproduced by creating a file with of 720 lines. Each line contained the word _as4gUrl_ exactly once.

While searching the word as4gUrl in the repository using Bitbucket search functionality it returned only 215 matchs.
fields.summary: Bitbucket code search functionality doesn't return all matches

fields.description:
We have a Bitbucket repository that triggers a CircleCI job when commits are made to an open pull request. Pull requests for the repository require a passing build to merge. This pull request had a passing build, but my colleague pushed new code to the remote branch during the service outage (which triggered a new build but left in a pending state for quite some time, due to the service outage). This should've invalidated the last build result but my colleague was then able to merge the pull request without a fresh build: he accidentally got around the passing build requirement.

It appears that a failure in invalidating build results is "fail-deadly" - I'd've expected the pull request's build status to be immediately invalid as soon as there are any new commits. In theory, Bitbucket has all the information to prevent this in the event that CircleCI does not respond with an up-to-date job status: it knows the latest commit, and if it stores the commit alongside the latest passing build job it triggered, it can immediately prevent merge of the pull request if these don’t match.

Incident happened on 10 April.
fields.summary: Bitbucket allowed merge of pull request with stale CircleCI build

fields.description:
It will be useful if the Alt+S key combination can trigger a click action on the save button while creating or editing an issue. Given that most of the work related to creation and editing of issues requires the use of the keyboard, allowing users to trigger saving issues from the keyboard will remove the need to use the mouse to click the buttons.

Similarly, it will also be useful if the Alt+C key combination can trigger a click on the cancel button.
fields.summary: Allow Alt+S to save issues

fields.description:
With the launch of the new editor for issues, the focus is placed on the Description field when a new issue is created. This has the following usability problems:

# The Description field is optional, so simply typing a description and not providing a Title will not work.
# For keyboard users, there is no easy way to go to the Title field (Shift+Tab does not take to the Title field, but highlights the editor buttons instead).

Given these two usability challenges, focus should be on the Title field when the page loads. This will make sure that the focus on the mandatory field instead of the optional field, and then the user can go to the Description field later on.

It will also be helpful if pressing Tab while in the Title field takes the user to the Description field instead of the editor buttons as then it takes too many tabs to get to the actual editable field.
fields.summary: When creating a new issue, the focus should be on the Title field instead of the Description field

fields.description:
Begin in *Jira Issue ORCA-499*  [https://hausadev.atlassian.net/browse/ORCA-499|https://hausadev.atlassian.net/browse/ORCA-499]

Click “1 branch” under *Development*

Click “Create pull request” from *ORCA-499: 1 branch* modal

The *Create a pull request* screen loads with “development” as the from branch on the left hand side, this should be the feature branch for ORCA-499:  feature/ORCA-499-recompile-hh.4gm

[https://bitbucket.org/hausadev/{3851cb09-7855-4f42-abf1-adb5f2dc279d}/pull-requests/new|https://bitbucket.org/hausadev/%257B3851cb09-7855-4f42-abf1-adb5f2dc279d%257D/pull-requests/new]

!977587165-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When creating a Pull Request from a feature branch, Bitbucket is showing the "From" Branch as development instead of that feature

fields.description:
‌

Hi All, please help me out to push my changes in to Bitbucket server whenever i am trying to push changes either via visual studio or via command prompt it’s stuck in 16 % and getting failed after 30 min
fields.summary: I am not able to push changes on to bitbucket server

The log above si the console log of a Jenkins pipeline that sometimes fails because of the failure of the following command:

{{git ls-remote --tags --heads ssh://git@bitbucket.org/alteadigital/aon-mycare-microservice.git}}
